eyefeatures.visualization package¶

Submodules¶

eyefeatures.visualization.dynamic_visualization module¶

eyefeatures.visualization.dynamic_visualization._built_figure(fig_dict, animation_duration=500)¶

Function for building a layout for plot

eyefeatures.visualization.dynamic_visualization.scanpath_animation(data_, x, y, path_color='green', path_width=0.5, points_color='black', points_width=6, add_regression=False, regression_color='red', rule=None, deviation=None, animation_duration=500, save_gif=None, frames_count=1)¶

Function for tracker animation

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame with fixations.

  • x (str) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (str) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • path_color (str) – color of saccades.

  • path_width (float) – width of saccades.

  • points_color (str) – color of points.

  • points_width (float) – width of points.

  • add_regression (bool) – whether to add regressions.

  • regression_color (str) – color of regressions.

  • rule (Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]) – must be either 1) tuple of quadrants direction to classify regressions, 1st quadrant being upper-right square of plane and counting anti-clockwise or 2) tuple of angles in degrees (0 <= angle <= 360).

  • deviation (Union[int, Tuple[int, ...], None]) – if None, then rule is interpreted as quadrants. Otherwise, rule is interpreted as angles. If integer, then is a +-deviation for all angles. If tuple of integers, then must be of the same length as rule, each value being a corresponding deviation for each angle. Angle = 0 is positive x-axis direction, rotating anti-clockwise.

  • animation_duration (int) – duration of animation.

  • save_gif (Optional[str]) – path to save animation.

  • frames_count (int) – TODO.

eyefeatures.visualization.dynamic_visualization.tracker_animation(data_, x, y, path_color='green', path_width=0.5, points_color='black', points_width=6, add_regression=False, regression_color='red', meta_data=None, rule=None, deviation=None, aoi=None, aoi_c=None, tracker_color='red', animation_duration=500, save_gif=None, frames_count=1)¶

Function for tracker animation

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame with fixations.

  • x (str) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (str) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • path_color (str) – color of saccades.

  • path_width (float) – width of saccades.

  • points_color (str) – color of points.

  • points_width (float) – width of points.

  • add_regression (bool) – whether to add regressions.

  • regression_color (str) – color of regressions.

  • meta_data (Optional[List[str]]) – list of columns that will be used for meta data.

  • rule (Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]) – must be either 1) tuple of quadrants direction to classify regressions, 1st quadrant being upper-right square of plane and counting anti-clockwise or 2) tuple of angles in degrees (0 <= angle <= 360).

  • deviation (Union[int, Tuple[int, ...], None]) – if None, then rule is interpreted as quadrants. Otherwise, rule is interpreted as angles. If integer, then is a +-deviation for all angles. If tuple of integers, then must be of the same length as rule, each value being a corresponding deviation for each angle. Angle = 0 is positive x-axis direction, rotating anti-clockwise.

  • aoi (Optional[str]) – AOI of fixations.

  • aoi_c (Optional[Dict[str, str]]) – colormap for AOI.

  • tracker_color (str) – color of tracker.

  • animation_duration (int) – duration of animation.

  • save_gif (Optional[str]) – path to save animation.

  • frames_count (int) – TODO.

eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization module¶

class eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization.Visualization(x, y, duration=None, dispersion=None, size_column=None, shape_column=None, time_stamps=None, aoi=None, img_path=None, fig_size=(10.0, 10.0), points_width=75, path_width=0.004, points_color='blue', path_color='green', points_enumeration=False, add_regressions=False, regression_color='red', micro_sac_color=None, is_vectors=False, min_dispersion=1.2, max_velocity=4.7, aoi_c=None, only_points=False, seq_colormap=False, show_hull=False, show_legend=False, path_to_img=None, with_axes=False, axes_limits=None, rule=None, deviation=None, is_gray=False)¶

eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization._cmap_generation(n)¶
eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization.aoi_visualization(data_, x, y, shape=(10, 10), aoi='AOI', size_column=None, shape_column=None, img_path=None, points_width=75, path_width=1, points_color=None, aoi_c=None, seq_colormap=False, show_legend=False, path_to_img=None, with_axes=False, axes_limits=None, return_ndarray=True, show_plot=True, only_points=True, dpi=100.0)¶
eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization.baseline_visualization(data_, x, y, shape=(10, 10), path_width=1, show_legend=False, path_to_img=None, with_axes=False, show_plot=False, return_ndarray=True, dpi=100.0)¶
eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization.get_visualizations(data, x, y, shape, pattern, dpi=100.0, pk=None)¶

Gets visualizations.

Parameters:

  • data (DataFrame) – Dataframe with fixations

  • patterns – List of Visualizations

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame.

Returns:

output –

[n, m, fig, fig, c]

n : instances

m : patterns

fig : fig size

c : (3 - RGB image; 1 - gray scaled image)

Return type:

(ndarray)

eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization.saccade_visualization(data_, x, y, shape=(10, 10), size_column=None, shape_column=None, duration=None, dispersion=None, time_stamps=None, img_path=None, path_width=1, path_color='green', add_regressions=False, regression_color='red', micro_sac_color=None, is_vectors=False, min_dispersion=1.2, max_velocity=4.7, seq_colormap=False, show_legend=False, path_to_img=None, with_axes=False, axes_limits=None, rule=(2,), deviation=None, return_ndarray=True, show_plot=True, dpi=100.0)¶
eyefeatures.visualization.static_visualization.scanpath_visualization(data_, x, y, duration=None, dispersion=None, size_column=None, shape_column=None, time_stamps=None, aoi=None, img_path=None, fig_size=(10.0, 10.0), points_width=75, path_width=0.004, points_color='blue', path_color='green', points_enumeration=False, add_regressions=False, regression_color='red', micro_sac_color=None, is_vectors=False, min_dispersion=1.2, max_velocity=4.7, aoi_c=None, only_points=False, seq_colormap=False, show_hull=False, show_legend=False, path_to_img=None, with_axes=False, axes_limits=None, rule=None, deviation=None, return_ndarray=False, show_plot=True, is_gray=False, dpi=100.0)¶

Function for scanpath visualization and aoi visualization.

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame with fixations.

  • x (str) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (str) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • duration (Optional[str]) – duration of fixation.

  • dispersion (Optional[str]) – dispersion of fixation.

  • size_column (Optional[str]) –

    label of the column, which is responsible for the size of the fixations(points on plot).

    It can be duration, dispersion, etc.

  • shape_column (Optional[str]) – label of the column, which is responsible for the shape of the fixations(points on plot).

  • time_stamps (Optional[str]) – time stamps of fixations.

  • aoi (Optional[str]) – AOI of fixations.

  • img_path (Optional[str]) – path to the background image.

  • fig_size (tuple[float, float]) – size of plot.

  • points_width (float) – width of points.

  • path_width (float) – width of path.

  • points_color (str) – color of points.

  • path_color (str) – color of path.

  • points_enumeration (bool) – whether to enumerate points.

  • add_regressions (bool) – whether to add regressions.

  • regression_color (str) – color of regressions.

  • micro_sac_color (Optional[str]) – color of microsaccades.

  • is_vectors (bool) – whether to visualize saccades as vectors

  • min_dispersion (float) – minimum dispersion.

  • max_velocity (float) – maximum velocity.

  • aoi_c (Optional[Dict[str, str]]) – colormap for AOI.

  • only_points (bool) – whether to only show points.

  • seq_colormap (bool) – whether to show sequentially-colored saccades.

  • show_hull (bool) – whether to show hull of AOI.

  • show_legend (bool) – whether to show legend.

  • path_to_img (Optional[str]) – path to save the plot image.

  • with_axes (bool) – whether to show axes.

  • axes_limits (Optional[tuple]) – limits of axes.

  • rule (Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]) – must be either 1) tuple of quadrants direction to classify regressions, 1st quadrant being upper-right square of plane and counting anti-clockwise or 2) tuple of angles in degrees (0 <= angle <= 360).

  • deviation (Union[int, Tuple[int, ...], None]) – if None, then rule is interpreted as quadrants. Otherwise, rule is interpreted as angles. If integer, then is a +-deviation for all angles. If tuple of integers, then must be of the same length as rule, each value being a corresponding deviation for each angle. Angle = 0 is positive x-axis direction, rotating anti-clockwise.

  • return_ndarray (bool) – whether to return numpy array of the plot image(returns RGBA array).

  • show_plot (bool) – whether to show the plot.

  • is_gray (bool) – whether to use the gray scale.

eyefeatures
